summary: This document is a series of email exchanges in March-April 2020 between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York's Epstein team. The emails discuss scheduling calls to provide updates and discuss Allred's clients, indicating ongoing communication between victims' counsel and federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with the SDNY Epstein prosecution team about scheduling calls to discuss updates and her clients' views.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Unnamed AUSA from the Southern District of New York reaching out to Gloria Allred to schedule calls for case updates and to discuss her clients.

connections.description: Professional communication regarding scheduling calls to discuss case updates and Allred's clients in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial call between Allred and SDNY
events.description: Gloria Allred and the SDNY Epstein team held a call where specific individuals (names redacted) were discussed.

events.title: Client decision pending
events.description: Allred reports that a client (name redacted) had ordered a new phone and would provide a decision the following day regarding unspecified options.

locations: Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg office)
New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York, St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: The SDNY Epstein prosecution team was actively communicating with victims' attorney Gloria Allred in March-April 2020.
The prosecution sought to discuss 'some of your clients in particular' and get their 'views and reactions'.
Multiple client names and contact details are redacted in the correspondence.
The emails show coordination for conference calls, indicating ongoing investigative or pre-trial discussions.
The document confirms Allred represented multiple clients relevant to the SDNY Epstein investigation.
